Headline: CSO: service-activation-failure seen when apply tcp-and-udp fw rule
Summary (Max 2K Chars): IMG: 0.2.8  >> steps: 1. create vpn ivpn333 2. create subvpn with access-design including two sites with dummy vCPE 3. configure 1 tcp-and-udp rule and following issue seen   >> issues (reproducible):  default-ivpn333-sales#  maxli@cso% *** ALARM service-activation-failure: RPC error towards n1: operation_failed: External error in the NED implementation for device tb-ng2-maxli-services_ivpn333-sales_NGENA-ASA_ASA_esc0_1: command: access-list ACL-INSIDE line 1 extended permit tcp-and-udp host 2.2.2.2 eq 100 host 1.1.1.1 log disable: and-udp host 2.2.2.2 eq 100 host 1.1.1.1 log disable  +++   << 1-Nov-2016::19:50:09.609 ERROR: External error in the NED implementation for device tb-ng2-maxli-services_ivpn333-sales_NGENA-ASA_ASA_esc0_1: command: access-list ACL-INSIDE line 1 extended permit tcp-and-udp host 2.2.2.2 eq 100 host 1.1.1.1 log disable: and-udp host 2.2.2.2 eq 100 host 1.1.1.1 log disable                                                                                 ^ ERROR: % Invalid input detected at '^' marker.  please refer to big-description enclosure for more info.

Headline: CSO: please enhance request devices xx compare-config
Summary (Max 2K Chars): compare-config is helpful to find out the diff if any, but now it prints out something which is not considered as difference, which is confused and user cannot tell what's the REAL diff.  please enhance this command to display the real diff, it can be a subcommand of compare-config.   ## admin@nso> request devices device tb-ng2-maxli-services_firewall-ivpn888-sales_ASA_esc0 compare-config  diff   devices {      device tb-ng2-maxli-services_firewall-ivpn888-sales_ASA_esc0 {          config {              asa:access-list {                  access-list-id CP-MGMT { -                    rule "extended permit udp 10.9.1.1 255.255.255.255 host 172.16.0.1 eq snmp"; -                    rule "extended permit udp 10.9.1.2 255.255.255.255 host 172.16.0.1 eq snmp"; +                    # first +                    rule "extended permit udp host 10.9.1.1 host 172.16.0.1 eq snmp"; +                    rule "extended permit udp host 10.9.1.2 host 172.16.0.1 eq snmp";                  }              }              asa:router {                  bgp 65001 {                      address-family {                          ipv4 {                              unicast { +                                auto-summary false;                              }                          }                      }                  }              }              asa:snmp-server { -                user mgmtuser { -                    groupname snmpv3; -                    v3; -                    auth sha; -                    auth-password cisco123; -                    priv aes; -                    bits 128; -                    password cisco123cisco123; -                }              }          }      }  }

Headline: CSO: firewall rule enhancement for any4, any6
Summary (Max 2K Chars): ASA, it gives all three options, CSO might provide similar options  configure mode commands/options:   A.B.C.D                Destination IP address   X:X:X:X::X/<0-128>     Destination IPv6 address/prefix   any                    Abbreviation for destination address/mask of 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 OR destination prefix ::/0   any4                   Abbreviation for destination address and mask of 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0   any6                   Abbreviation for destination prefix ::/0

Headline: CSO: please change command description string for check-sync and deep-check-sync
Summary (Max 2K Chars): please change command description string be more descriptive so that user knows the differences and when to use it.  admin@cso> request vpn vpn200 ? Possible completions:   activation-tests   -    check-sync         - Check if device config is according to the service  ----->>   commit-queue       -    deep-check-sync    - Check if device config is according to the service  ---->>  #### Here is the relevant section from the manual:  check-sync Verify that the service and the associated device configuration is in-sync. Any differences will be displayed in a chosen out-format. If configuration changes has been made out-of-band then deep-check-sync is needed to detect a out-of-sync condition. deep-check-sync This will validate it the actual devices are configured according to the service. Note that there are outformat options to see the diff. Reconcile using service redeploy.

Headline: CSO: fail to apply fw rule after service created without vCPE onboard (service-activation-failure)

[ok][2016-10-15 21:25:28]  [edit] admin@cso% *** ALARM service-activation-failure: RPC error towards n1: operation_failed: RPC error towards esc0: operation_failed: Work order validation failed: Work item validation failed for Delete: Config [SubnetConfig:SystemAdminTenantIdtestfw-apple-pxtr-fwsn, configStatus: ACTIVE] is still referred to by config: [ServiceConfig:SystemAdminTenantIdcsr-pxtr-testfw-apple, configStatus: ACTIVE] admin@cso%

Headline: CSO: External error in the NED implementation raised with port-range fw rule
Summary (Max 2K Chars): failed to apply fw rule to vASA for rule wit port-range, it seems NSO try to push rule per port which caused error, instead of doing rule per port, it should be applied as value in range, for example:  default-firewall-ivpn188maxli-sales# show running-config access-list | i range access-list test extended permit tcp host 3.3.3.3 range 20000 40000 any   admin@nso> *** ALARM service-activation-failure: External error in the NED implementation for device tb-ng2-maxli-services_firewall-ivpn266maxli-sales_ASA_esc0: command: access-list ACL-INSIDE extended permit  host 192.168.166.4 eq 12345 any eq 80 log disable: 68.166.4 eq 12345 any eq 80 log disable  rule allow_vCPE1 {             protocol tcp;             source {                 ip 192.168.166.4;                 port-range {                     from 12345;                     to   56789;                 }             }             destination {                 any;                 port 80;             }         }  ## -- meta-data :: add-keyword :: PATCH: new line 'access-list ACL-INSIDE "extended permit  host 192.168.166.4 eq 56650 any eq 80" log disable' -- meta-data :: add-keyword :: PATCH: new line 'access-list ACL-INSIDE "extended permit  host 192.168.166.4 eq 56651 any eq 80" log disable' -- meta-data :: add-keyword :: PATCH: new line 'access-list ACL-INSIDE "extended permit  host 192.168.166.4 eq 56652 any eq 80" log disable' -- meta-data :: add-keyword :: PATCH: new line 'access-list ACL-INSIDE "extended permit  host 192.168.166.4 eq 56653 any eq 80" log disable' ##

Headline: CSO: RPC error towards n1: operation_failed: no interface LISP0.2001
Summary (Max 2K Chars): following error seen when deleting access-design from CSO.  tried narrow down the issue by running no command on pxtr and found out that "no vrf definition ivpn22-sales" will cause LISP0.2001 interface removed too, therefore such issue appeared when "no interface LISP0.2001" applied later on.    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ admin@cso% delete access-design SITE100  [ok][2016-10-04 18:23:59]  [edit] admin@cso% delete access-design SITE200 [ok][2016-10-04 18:24:01]  [edit] admin@cso% commit  Aborted: RPC error towards n1: operation_failed: External error in the NED implementation for device tb-ng2-maxli-services_csr-pxtr-ivpn22-sales_CSR_esc0: no interface LISP0.2001:  no interface LISP0.2001               ^ % Invalid input detected at '^' marker. [error][2016-10-04 18:24:41]  [edit] admin@cso%  *** IDLE TIMEOUT ***   ### snip ###  no vrf definition ivpn22-sales call-home  no source-interface GigabitEthernet1 ! no ip access-list standard SNMP-ACL-V4 no ip access-list standard VTY-ACL-V4 no route-map BGP-IPV4-OUT permit 100 no ip prefix-list INTERNAL-V4 seq 5 permit 0.0.0.0/0 le 32 no ip prefix-list NO-RESOLVE-V4 seq 5 deny 0.0.0.0/0 le 32 no crypto isakmp policy 20 no crypto isakmp keepalive 15 periodic ! meta-data :: /ncs:devices/device{tb-ng2-maxli-services_csr-pxtr-ivpn22-sales_CSR_esc0}/config/ios:crypto/isakmp/key{198.18.1.57}/keystring :: secret-password :: crypto isakmp key <PASSWORD> address <ke y> no crypto isakmp key b36a6a5d address 198.18.1.57 interface GigabitEthernet2  no crypto map crypto-map-001 exit no crypto map crypto-map-001 10 gdoi no crypto gdoi group ivpn22-CONTROL-PLANE no crypto map crypto-map-001 20 gdoi no crypto gdoi group ivpn22-DATA-PLANE no interface LISP0.2001   -------------------------->>> no interface LISP0

Headline: CSO: should not allow two primary IPs defined for one interface
Summary (Max 2K Chars): In the ngena-access-design-cfs module it defines cpe->ip as leaf-list which allows multiple instances. But it does not seem right to allow two primary IPs defined for one interfaces.    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ## cso ## access-design SITE4 {     customer-id       ivpn224748id;     vpn-name          ivpn224748;     bandwidth         5000;     internet-breakout regional;     activate-lan      true;     cpe cpe1 {         serial-number 95MQHCHBEC5;     }     cpe-parameters {         physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 1" {             wan {                 data-center dc1;             }         }         physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 2";     }     customer-lan {         vpn sales {             l3-interface 1 {                 l2-domain {                     physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 2";                 }                 cpe cpe1 {                     ip 192.168.188.6/24;   --->                     ip 192.168.188.7/24;   ---->                 }             }         }     } }  ## nso ## GigabitEthernet 2 {                     negotiation {                         auto true;                     }                     vrf {                         forwarding sales;                     }                     ip {                         address {                             primary {                                 address 192.168.188.7;                                 mask    255.255.255.0;                             }                         }                     }                 }  ## cpe ## cpe#show running-config interface gigabitEthernet 2 Building configuration... Current configuration : 114 bytes ! interface GigabitEthernet2  vrf forwarding sales  ip address 192.168.188.7 255.255.255.0  negotiation auto end cpe#

Headline: CSO/NSO: CPE-LAN: Access Vlans are Not Configurable in physical CPE with L2 NIM cards
Summary (Max 2K Chars): Tried to create cpe-lan with access vlan in Physical CPE on NIM Layer 2 Interface module.  And found that NSO is trying to configure ?vrf forwardin <sales>? on layer 2 interface.

Headline: when new sub vpn created and added to already existing Access Design , service vm's not created

Headline: CPE-LAN: RPC error on CSO while configuring RIPNG

Headline: CPE-LAN: bgpipv6 config is not pushed to CPE

Headline: When vlan id is changed in AD on CSO, on CPE new vlan-id is appended instead of replaced
Summary (Max 2K Chars): cpe-parameters {     physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 0/0/0" {         wan {             data-center dc1;         }     }     physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 0/1/0" {         switch-mode           trunk;         trunk-allowed-vlan-id [ 100 ];     }     physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 0/1/1" {         switch-mode           trunk;         trunk-allowed-vlan-id [ 100 ];     } } customer-lan {     vpn sales {         l3-interface 3 {             l2-domain {                 vlan-id 100;                 physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 0/1/0";                 physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 0/1/1";             }             cpe cpe2 {                 ip 192.168.189.10/24;             }         }     } }  in the above config vlan-id under l2-domain changed from 100 to 1000. In this case , VLAN id 1000 is appended on CPE interfaces instead of replaced  as below interface GigabitEthernet0/1/0  switchport trunk allowed vlan 100,1000  switchport mode trunk ! interface GigabitEthernet0/1/1  switchport trunk allowed vlan 100,1000  switchport mode trunk !

Headline: Locator set name is different in NSO and Template

NSO is using "ALL" where as template is using "INTERNET01"  router lisp  eid-table vrf $vpn_name instance-id $vpn_id   ipv4 route-import database ospf $vpn_id route-map RM-$vpn_name-LAN2LISPV4 locator-set INTERNET01  LOGS on NSO: ********************* CPE-NUKALA# << 22-Oct-2016::14:07:42.100 ERROR: External error in the NED implementation for device cpe-FLM2029W01W: ipv4 route-import database ospf 20 route-map RM-sales-LAN2LISPV4 locator-set INTERNET01: ^M % No locator-set named 'INTERNET01'.

Headline: Adding BGP config in Access-Design on CSO causing CPE to lose most of the config
Summary (Max 2K Chars): Steps: 1. Created Access Design on CSO without BGP as below admin@cso% show access-design  access-design a2 {     customer-id       cnukala;     vpn-name          nukala;     bandwidth         5000;     internet-breakout regional;     activate-lan      true;     cpe cpe1 {         serial-number 9THSEP4E6OA;     }     cpe-parameters {         physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 1" {             wan {                 data-center dc1;             }         }         physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 2" {             switch-mode trunk;         }     }     customer-lan {         vpn sales {             l3-interface 1 {                 l2-domain {                     physical-interface "GigabitEthernet 2";                 }                 cpe cpe1 {                     ip 192.168.177.10/24;                     ip 2001:100::100/64;                 }             }         }     } }  At this point , all the config mentioned in AD is loaded to CPE  2. Now add below BGP config.   admin@cso% set access-design a2 customer-lan vpn sales l3-interface 1 routing bgpipv4 metric 100 neighbors 192.168.177.50 asn-id 65530 password cisco123 [ok][2016-10-20 17:19:22]  [edit] admin@cso% commit   After this Most of the CPE config wiped out. If BGP config removed again on CSO, then CPE config reloaded . (Back to Step 1)

Headline: Document update - ncs-setup reset is for factory resetting a local install
Summary (Max 2K Chars): ncs-setup --reset command is for factory resetting a local install only. The command does not work for system install of NCS (CSO or NSO).  Need to update help documentation below to clarify it.  Perhaps add information in it to properly perform a factory reset for a system install   wpangton@tb-ng2-wpangton-cso:/opt/ncs/current/bin$ ncs-setup -h Usage: ncs-setup --dest DIR [options]  Setup an initial NCS instance, optionally pre-configured with a set of managed devices.  Options:   -h, --help            Show this help message and exit.  ... ...    --reset               Stop NCS and reset NCS to factory defaults. ... ...

Headline: Changing fw rule from port range to a specific port or part any failed
Summary (Max 2K Chars): tried to modify a fw rule which has port-range to a specific port.  It failed with the following error: Aborted: 'sub-vpns wp1 sub-vpn wp1 outbound-firewall-rules rule NTP2 destination port-range' : From port must be strictly lower than to port.  It looks like the port-range config was not deleted properly / fully.

Summary (Max 2K Chars): CSO should have a check / error handling when firewall rules are submitted in a no internet breakout service.   Note: there is no impact when the fw rules are submitted.

CPE-NED.trace; =========   *** input 2-Nov-2016::01:01:17.633 *** router lisp ^M SiteP3I8-tesco011234(config-router-lisp)#    *** output 2-Nov-2016::01:01:17.658 *** no locator-set INTERNET01    *** input 2-Nov-2016::01:01:17.985 *** no locator-set INTERNET01 ^M % Cannot delete a locator set used by database mapping^M SiteP3I8-tesco011234(config-router-lisp)#    *** output 2-Nov-2016::01:01:18.013 *** exit    *** input 2-Nov-2016::01:01:18.107 *** exit^M SiteP3I8-tesco011234(config)#    *** output 2-Nov-2016::01:01:18.107 *** exit    *** input 2-Nov-2016::01:01:18.197 *** exit^M SiteP3I8-tesco01123456aaaabbbbccc431000isr8# << 2-Nov-2016::01:01:18.198 ERROR: External error in the NED implementation for device cpe-FLM2029W022: no locator-set INTERNET01: ^M % Cannot delete a locator set used by database mapping >> 2-Nov-2016::01:01:37.249 CLOSE 5: (Pool: false) << 2-Nov-2016::01:01:37.251 CLOSED

Headline: NSO CPE-IPSLA; logging configuration missing + remove control-plane host
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO FP ngena-rel-0.2.6_161026.1319,   #1 ; CPE config with CPE-IPSLA is missing some logging configuration lines;  logging host 172.16.1.79 vrf CPE-MGMT transport udp port 9993 discriminator ipsec  #2 ; and in Day0 config;  'syslog verbose' is missing under 'router lisp'  router lisp  syslog verbose  #3 ; also, the 'control-plane host' configuration is dropping all cpe-ipsla packets. We need to remove from CPE configuration until a better configuration is found;  Please remove from NSO;  control-plane host  management-interface Tunnel0 allow ssh snmp   management-interface Tunnel1 allow ssh snmp  Inigo is also removing this from the template.  Thanks.       Those are required for IPSLA tests and demo

Headline: NSO NED-CPE error [polaris]; crypto gdoi group server addr, log % Updated Group CP to IPv4

NED-cpe is not expecting this message and raises an error. Onboarding aborts.    SiteP3I2-tesco011234(config)#crypto gdoi group Volvo-control-plane SiteP3I2-tesco011234(config-gkm-group)#identity number 2999 SiteP3I2-tesco011234(config-gkm-group)#server address ipv4 173.39.209.52 % Updated Group CP to IPv4  NED-cpe; ====== SiteP3I2-tesco011234(config-gkm-group)#   *** output 26-Oct-2016::23:23:12.321 *** server address ipv4 173.39.209.52   *** input 26-Oct-2016::23:23:15.860 *** server address ipv4 173.39.209.52 ^M % Updated Group CP to IPv4^M ... << 26-Oct-2016::23:23:27.578 ERROR: External error in the NED implementation for device cpe-FLM2029W024: server address ipv4 173.39.209.52: ^M % Updated Group CP to IPv4 >> 26-Oct-2016::23:23:27.600 CLOSE 2: (Pool: false)

Headline: Custom Firewall Rules; NED-ASA error after deleting old rule (not last) + re-adding rule
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO ngena-rel-0.2.6_161026.1319, with this sequence of custom dynamic FW rules configurations;  1. add rule3 tcp  2. add rule4 another tcp 3. del  rule3 tcp 4. re-add same rule3 tcp  NED-asa is failing on step4. See full logs attached. Also, during rollback, NSO NED-asa seems to touch some ACL other than ACL-INSIDE on asa.  Logs attached.

Headline: IPSLA NSO: External error in the NED implementation for device cpe-FLM2029W022: ip sla 1000
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO 0.2.5, when deleting an access-design with IPSLA configured, NSO NED is failing when trying to modify/delete the ip sla config;  cloud@cso% commit Aborted: RPC error towards n1: operation_failed: External error in the NED implementation for device cpe-FLM2029W022: ip sla 1000: Entry already running and cannot be modified (only can delete (no) and start over) (check to see if the probe has finished exiting) [error][2016-10-26 21:15:59]  Instead of trying to edit the 'ip sla 1000' section, NED should just delete it 'no ip sla 1000' Or for updated, NED should delete it, and re-create from scratch it with the updated config.

Headline: mgmt-hub NED error; Virtual-template config is locked, active vaccess present
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO 0.2.5_161020, with mgmt-hub, during access-design and updates, NSO is attempting to remove or reconfigure 'interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel' on mgmt-hub.  This is not allowd by IOS-XE if vaccess are present (crypto ike sessions up).  For access-design deletion, NSO should remove ike clients first on CPE, for update, I found this on CCO, not sure if that's an option; http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_conn_vpnips/configuration/15-2s/sec-ipsec-virt-tunnl.html, section 'Virtual Template Lock'  logs; ==== rtp-mgmt-hub(config)#    *** output 25-Oct-2016::14:38:33.812 *** interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel    *** input 25-Oct-2016::14:38:34.127 *** interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel ^M % Virtual-template config is locked, active vaccess present^M  ERROR: External error in the NED implementation for device p-3-services_mgmt-hub_NGENA-CSR-MGMT-HUB_MGMT-HUB_esc0_1: interface Virtual-Template1 type tunnel: ^M % Virtual-template config is locked, active vaccess present >> 25-Oct-2016::14:38:35.525 CLOSE 2: (Pool: false) << 25-Oct-2016::14:38:35.528 CLOSED

Headline: CPE LAN; ip tcp adjust-mss configs missing on SVIs + Tunnel0
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CPE (with FP 0.2.5_161025), some lines of config are missing on CPE ;  int Vlan xxx   ip tcp adjust-mss 1346   ipv6 tcp adjust-mss 1326  int Tunnel0   ip tcp adjust-mss 1420    Those are causing issue with large packets at the moment.  Also, some other config lines are missing, security related, see below. From; http://gitlab.cisco.com/X-ARCH-EMEAR/ngena/blob/master/service-configs/mvp0.2/full/cpe-XS-cfg.txt  int Vlan xxx   no ip redirects   no ip unreachables   no ip proxy-arp   ntp disable etc.

Headline: NSO mgmt-hub; Fix prefix-list CPE-MGMT-V4 for redistribution mgmt Loopbacks to bgp
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On mgmt-hub (FP 0.2.5_161025), the current prefix-list for redistribution of mgmt-hub + CPE loopbacks to bgp is;   ip prefix-list CPE-MGMT-V4 description CPE V4 Mgmt Range   ip prefix-list CPE-MGMT-V4 seq 5 permit 172.19.3.0/24 le 32  it should be matching the loopbacks instead;   ip prefix-list CPE-MGMT-V4 description CPE V4 Mgmt Range    ip prefix-list CPE-MGMT-V4 seq 5 permit 10.10.10.0/24 le 32  It looks like we are currently using the mgmt-hub.mgmt-range variable. We should be using something like the pnp.mgmt-address-start instead,   but that one does not have a netmask...  we may need a new variable for this.

Headline: CSO should not allow underscore in cpe name (cpe name is reused in ikev2 id fqdn)
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO function pack 0.2.4_161020, CSO is allowing CPE names with underscores. This CPE name is later re-used to configure the crypto ikev2 profile identity fqdn on CPE + mgmt-hub.  crypto profile identify fqdn should comply with:  (cpe name as well, if we reuse same string) "The Internet standards (Requests for Comments) for protocols mandate that component hostname labels may contain only the ASCII letters 'a' through 'z' (in a case-insensitive manner), the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-'). The original specification of hostnames in RFC 952, mandated that labels could not start with a digit or with a hyphen, and must not end with a hyphen. However, a subsequent specification (RFC 1123) permitted hostname labels to start with digits. No other symbols, punctuation characters, or white space are permitted."

Headline: NED Firewall ACL; protocol icmp type issues
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO function pack 0.2.4_161020, 2 issues with custom firewall rules.  1. when optional value icmp-type is not configured, NED appends a 'null' at the end of the CLI on ASA; *** ALARM service-activation-failure: External error in the NED implementation for device p-3-services_VPN1-sub1_NGENA-ASA_ASA_esc0_1: command: access-list ACL-INSIDE extended permit icmp any any null log disable: y null log disable  The 'null' keyword should be removed.  2. When icmp-type is configured with more that 2 types; *** ALARM service-activation-failure: External error in the NED implementation for device p-3-services_Volvo-sales_NGENA-ASA_ASA_esc0_1: command: access-list ACL-INSIDE extended permit icmp any any 0 1 8 log disable: y 0 1 8 log disable  ASAv does not support more that 2 icmp types in same command. CSO CLI should prevent more than 2 icmp-types values.  See email attached.

Headline: Some trace files are missing on CSO & NSO after logrotate
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO & NSO function pack 0.2.2_161014 (but this is not ngena related, generic NCS issue?) After logrotate, some trace files are missing on CSO and NSO;   CSO; missing netconf-n1.trace   NSO; missing some NED trace files  those trace do not get re-created, even if some new objects are created or old objects updated. Woakraound;   touch <trace file>

Headline: NSO KeyServer ACLs defined for control & data planes not applied on crypto gdoi group
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO function pack 0.2.2_161014 the KeyServer Access-list defined for data plane traffic is not the one which is actually applied on the crypto gdoi group ;   we have 2 acls instead of 1;      ext-named-acl VPN1-data-plane          <— is configured and populated with the correct ACL entries, good      ext-named-acl ACLV4-VPN1-DATA-PLANE  <— is configured but empty, and this one is actually applied on the crypto gdoi group GDOI-VPN1-DATA-PLANEV4  Same issue on control plane. As a result, the crypto gdoi members (CPE, PxTR, etc) are receiving empty ACLs.  see triage email attached

Headline: CSO sub-vpn with custom services-ipv4-subnet  causes abort during AD deletion
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO with function pack 0.2.2_161014, after configuring a sub-vpn with non-default services-ipv4-subnet, access-desgns deletions abort with error;  Aborted: 'resource-pools ip-address-pool sub-vpn-pool-VPN1-sub1 allocation VPN1-n1-sub1-fw username' is not configured  See logs + triage email attached.

Headline: NSO CPE LAN ospf authentication, message-digest-key is missing
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO function pack ngena 0.2.2_161014, when configuring an access-design with CPE LAN routing ospf,  'ip ospf message-digest-key <key-id> md5 <key>' is missing. See triage email attached.

Headline: NSO CPE LAN routing; locator-set INTERNET01 definition is missing
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO function pack ngena 0.2.2_161014, when configuring an access-design with CPE LAN routing (ospf in this case), the CPE router lisp   'locator set INTERNET01'  configuration is missing, should be added.   See logs + triage email attached.

Headline: NSO NED ios:ip name-server issue when importing 2 ip addresses
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO NED (NSO 4.3.0 with ngena function pack 0.2.2_161005, but it looks like a generic NED issue);  When adding a second ios:ip name-server ip from NSO, the correct configuration is applied on the device, but the IOS-XE device groups the 2 name-server ip addresses under 1 single line;     ip name-server 8.8.8.8 9.9.9.9  NSO is then unable to parse this IOS-XE configuration line with 2 ip addresses, and fails to import. Device sync-from on NSO results in the ios:ip name-server section to be emptied.  See logs attached.

Headline: Firewall rules; ipv6 prefix lengths are dropped on NSO, causing ACL fail on ASAv
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO Function Pack 0.2.2_161005 with 'Custom firewall rules' feature; when configuring an ipv6 access-list on CSO, the ipv6 prefix lengths are being dropped on NSO/NED before the ACL is applied to ASAv, this causes the ACL configuration to fail.  See triage email attached. Full logs on http://10.53.233.235/NGENA/TestLogs/11oct_fw_rule_ipv6_fail.txt

Headline: access-design creation fails on sub-vpn without internet breakout
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO FP 0.2.2_161005 with CSCvb34888 integrated; When attempting to create an access-design on a sub-vpn without internet-breakout, it fails with;  Trace : [java.lang.NullPointerException]         com.ngena.cfs.accessDesignCFS.hasInternetBreakout(accessDesignCFS.java:839)  Full logs on http://10.53.233.235/NGENA/TestLogs/11oct_sub_internet-breakout-False_AD_creation_fails.txt

Headline: AD deletion; NSO deletes subnet+net before VNF, causing ESC confd transaction abort
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO 0.2.2_161009 + ESC 2.2.8, during service chain deletion, NSO is attempting to delete the internel pxtr-asav neutron subnet+net before deleting the attached VNFs pxtr+asav.  On previous FP + ESC 2.1.8, this was causing Warnings, but no abort. This is now causing Confd Transaction Abort on ESC and prevents AD deletion. WA for AS deletion; remove components manually on NSO.  Full logs on http://10.53.233.235/NGENA/TestLogs/6oct_del_ad_fail_ESC_work_order.txt  INFO  Deleting subnet [sn] before deleting network [ivpn20161006T164116-sub1-pxtr-fw] INFO  =====  DELETE NETWORK REQUEST ACCEPTED  ===== WARN  CDB subscription iteration is cancelled. WARN  Aborting ConfD transaction due to: Work order validation failed: Work item validation failed for Delete: Config [SubnetConfig:SystemAdminTenantIdivpn20161006T164116-sub1-pxtr-fwsn, configStatus: ACTIVE] is still referred to by config: [ServiceConfig:SystemAdminTenantIdcsr-pxtr-ivpn20161006T164116-sub1, configStatus: ACTIVE]

Headline: Firewall custom rules, rename keywords  ip to host, netmask to prefix
Summary (Max 2K Chars): Currenty on CSO FP 0.2.2_161005 firewall custom rule syntax is; cloud@cso% set sub-vpns X sub-vpn Y outbound-firewall-rules rule 1 protocol tcp source ? Possible completions:   any  ip  netmask  port  port-any  port-range  'ip'      accepts an ip address a.b.c.d 'netmask' accepts a prefix a.b.c.d/e  which is confusing. rename; ip to host netmask to prefix

Headline: NSO should re-apply Day1 config after deleted VNF is respawned by ESC.
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO FP 0.2.2_161005. Negative test; after doing a 'nova delete' on a VNF, ESC detects VM down, attempts recovery, nova boots a new VNF with day0 config, notifies NSO about 'VM_RECOVERY_COMPLETE' Success. NSO should then re-apply day1 config. This is currently not occurring, VNF is left with day0 config.  See full logs attached

Headline: vpn-infra VNFs stuck in 'unknown', never reaching 'done' state
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On NSO with latest FP 0.2.0_160930, when creating a vpn on CSO, the infra VNFs KeyServer and MapServer are stuck in 'unknown', never reaching 'done' state, preventing sub-vpns deployments.  [Johannes]: The issue with vpn state appeared when we started using plans in nso. The nso plans are not visible from cso which is why some values show up as "unknown" now. This is a bug somewhere in the nso ecosystem  Triage email + full logs attached.

Headline: Umbrella DDTS for NGENA CPE LAN trunked+native access
Summary (Max 2K Chars): Placeholder for ngena CPE LAN access in trunk mode issues:  Issue #1; On CSO/NSO service Pack ngena 0.2.0_160909, when configuring trunked + native vlans simultaneously on CPE LAN access port, the following IOS config line is missing on CPE LAN GiE interface:   cpe(config)#int gi0/1/0   cpe(config-if)#switchport trunk native vlan <native_vlan> Logs attached.

Headline: LISP EID mapping should be removed when removing L3-interface
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO/NSO with servicePack 0.2.0_160909, when deleting a trunked vlan + associated L3-interface on CPE access-design, the corresponding Router lisp > eid db-mapping should be removed.  Please find repto logs + NED-cpe.trace attached

Headline: subvpn with internet-breakout=false should not spin up service chain
Summary (Max 2K Chars): On CSO servicePack 0.2.0_160909, when creating a subvpn with option 'with-internet-breakout' = false, CSO/NSO is spinning up PxTR+ASAv. No service chain should be created in this case.  See email attached.
